intro: Tithymalus plebeius, commonly known as the common tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent. Tithymalus plebeius is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
